item.title: [SPR-1779] FORM Tag library issues
item.description:
The new FORM tags have acouple issues to be handled in my opinion:

  • no getter methods for the fields like onchange so derived tags can access
  • TagWriter needs to be public not package private so derived tags can override the write writeTagContent
  • some fields are protected and others are private, should be consistent
  • HTML readonly and disabled attributes should be added to HtmlInput Tags
  • TagSupport.release methods should reset local fields

I think these will help improve the library.
Nuri

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

Nuri,

I've added 'readonly', 'disabled' and 'delimiter' as appropriate. The protected fields you mention are not private.

With regards to the getters() and the TagWriter I'm interested to know what use cases for extension you have in mind. Tag library extension isnt simple because of the need for a custom TLD and I had originally envisioned that anything really customised would be done with the 'bind' tags. That said I am not opposed to adding set extension mechanisms if needed.

For release() - its is not necessary to call release() unless there are some expensive resources that need releasing at the end of the page processing. The JSP spec is very clear as to when tag instances can be reused (only when the attribute set matches) and as such there should be no need for internal fields to be reset in the release() method. Note also that release() is only going to be called once per page per tag instance.

An interesting discussion on this can be found at: http://www.caucho.com/resin-3.0/jsp/tutorial/taglib-reuse/index.xtp

Regards,

Rob

Scott,

Hello Rob,

Maybe I am doing it wrong but, I extended your Input field to provide a simple hilite-when-entered and dehilite-when-out javascript to the default text field onfocus and onblur. To do this needed to override writeTagContent for my custom tag. Then went further and extended this text input to have a image of a calendar on the right side if the user wanted to use it as a date entry field. Again the writeTagContent was needed. And on a test page had one of each field and the onblur and onfocus got duplicated when looked at the html output source. When I put a release, then things seem to work as expected. I am running on Oracle 10g AS...The reason I needed the getters was to concat my default onblur javascript with the user one if any so as to keep the user functionality and just add the hiliting feature. Of course had to define two seperate tags and their TLD.

How could this be done thru bind tags?

Regards,
Nuri

Nuri,

I added the getters that you need and made TagWriter public. As for release() - I've tested this a number of times and I cannot reproduce your problem - can you submit a case that highlights this. The spec wording implies that the current approach should work just fine, but if it doesn't I really need to get to the bottom of this to find out why.

Rob

I'd like to add support for submit buttons (<input type="submit">).

Since the value of the submit button usually comes out of a <fmt:message /> construct, it'll be great to have some syntax like

<form:submit>myvalue</form:submit> or
<form:submit><value>myvalue</value></form:submit>

Otherwise, I'd have to assign the localized string to a local variable first.
